name: Hilton Grand Vacations at the Flamingo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from a 6 day stay at HGVC @ the Flamingo. We found the location to be excellent - it is only a few minutes walk past the pool and through the Flamingo casino and you are right in the middle of the strip opposite Caesers Palace. Being set back from the strip meant that the hotel felt more peaceful, so it was nice to come back to after a busy day.
reviews.title: Great location and comfortable hotel

reviews.text: I used the pool area once and found it well equipped with comfortable sunbeds, plenty of towels, a small bar and a big jacuzzi as well as the pool. The pool area felt quite luxurious in comparison to the Flamingo's pool, which was much bigger but felt crowded and noisy.
reviews.title: Good rooms, great location, doof for business or pleasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a one bed apartment, with a jacuzzi which was great. The apartment was comfortable and well equipped (eg well stocked kitchen, coffee machine, useful washer and dryer). Our room was refurbished room and not at all pink which was a relief!
reviews.title: Perfect Location!

reviews.text: The only downside was that the place is fairly anonymous, and you're not staying in a recreation of Venice, New York etc as in some of the other hotels. However we had a really comfortable stay, and enjoyed the relative peace of HGVC. The great location would particularly encourage us to return here.
reviews.title: I LOVE this property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the HGVC Flamingo 3/22 - 3/27 2009. I had a studio room on the 16th floor. the room was very spacious. I enjoyed having a small fridge, microwave and coffee maker. there is an excellent whirlpool bath set up - there is a large opening between the bathtub and the main room, so you can have a good soak and watch TV if you want. There is a separate private shower and toilet area. The TV was a flat screen of decent size (42" ?) and the channel selection was good. service was good - daily maid service and friendly staff all around. Small grocery store and deli on the premises was useful, fair prices and good food and excellent coffee.
reviews.title: Love the renovations!

reviews.text: Spent 5 nights with my family at a two bedroom suite at the Hilton Grand Vacations Club at the Flamingo. The two bedroom suite is really a one bedroom and a studio with a combined entry way. The staff was helpful - including the pn-site concierge who got us some good deals for shows. The property is "off the strip" and shares the pool area with the Flamingo. The weather was junk while we were there - cold but the HGVC pool and hot tub were heated and open, while the Flamingo pool was closed. Valet parking is $9 a day but there is free parking in a parking garage shared with O'shea's and the Imperial Palace. We self parked and had no problems finding space. The property does not have a casino which is a nice respite from some of the casino hotels. There is a small but well stocked canteen but there were groceries nearby (~3 miles) if you planned to cook. The kitchen in the one bedroom was well fixed - full size stove and refrigerator, plus a microwave. We cooked breakfasts to keep the costs down. We'd go back.
reviews.title: Enjoyable, convenient location

likes.disliked: — No covered way to get to the Flamingo next door,

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for a business convention for 3 nights.
reviews.title: Good Stay at this Non-Casino Hotel

likes.liked: — Location & Own Entrance to the hotel
likes.disliked: — Nothing really, except non-charging privilages with Flamingo

reviews.title: splendid
reviews.text: Had a very nice corner 1 bedroom suite on the 8th floor facing the east and the airport.
Check-in was very efficient and felt very secure when you have to enter your key 24 hours a day to get to your floor.
reviews.title: A Grand Time at the Hilton Grand @ Flamingo

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Excellent Location Location Location

likes.disliked: — That the flamingo pool closed early.. no control by HGVC though...

reviews.text: We had a one bedroom on the 2nd floor overlooking the pool. We had a full kitchen, nicely stock with cooking necessities. I only would suggest they replace some of the well-used utensils. There was a stacked washer and dryer, fold out sofa bed and plenty of fresh towels. The bathroom has two separate counters with sinks and plenty of counter space. The jetted tub is huge and circular; made for two but could fit more if you want to. No complaints about the room. The entire interior was recently updated so all is nice, clean and new.
reviews.title: Excellent Vegas Location!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool is small but quiet and relaxing with a full bar and misters. The Flamingo pool, which Hilton guests have full access to is a very crowded, mostly young scene. It is nice to be able to choose between the two pools. On weekdays the Go Pool at the Flamingo is not at all crowded. There is loud music and a bar with plenty of free lounges. It is $10 for men to get in and bikini tops are optional. There were very few who went topless.
reviews.title: Fantastic Flamingo

reviews.text: The small mini-mart and deli at the Hilton is convenient and has good Starbucks espresso drinks. The center strip location is excellent! It is a short walk over LV Blvd to Cesars and Bellagio. THe Venetian also isn't too bad a walk. To walk much further in the summer Vegas heat isn't fun. We took the monorail from Flamingo/HGVC a lot. There is an elevator right to the monorail stop outside the main lobby of Hilton or there's a bridge that goes from the Flamingo alongside the pool area to the monorail. It will take you as far as MGM Grand and Sahara. There is a free monorail if you walk across the street from the MGM to Excalibur. This one goes from Excalibur to Luxor and Mandalay Bay. If you want to be on the strip for some Vegas action this is the perfect spot!
reviews.title: Very comfortable

reviews.text: There is an Albertson's a short ($10 ?) cab ride away and a liquor and convenience store just behind the Hilton. We really enjoyed Pure at Cesars, dinner at the Voodoo Lounge on top of the Rio (excellent steaks! and view!), and the Thunder from Down Under show at the Excalibur. The show was perfect for a bachelorette party. Its a little cheesy but definitely a fun time. If you have a large group (6 or more people) the limos can be cheaper than cabs. They will negotiate on weeknights.
reviews.title: Poor service and poor room at HGVC. Go elsewhere.

reviews.text: In case you haven't already heard tell the cab driver to take Paradise Road to and from the airport and not the freeway. It is about the same amount of time and about $12-$15 instead of $25. Also, it is illegal for cabs and limos to stop on the strip to pick people up. It is well enforced so don't bother. Go to a hotel taxi stand for a cab or limo.
reviews.title: Fabulous staff and accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really liked the location of this hotel. It’s right behind the Flamingo, so we just had to walk around the pool area and through the Flamingo casino to get to the Strip. Our room was a king studio suite with a nice view of the pool and gardens. It was a good size with a kitchenette, Jacuzzi, sofa bed and flat screen TV. The hotel was very quiet. There were people staying in the next room, and we never heard them at all. There’s a fee to use the computers, but it’s free to print out an airline boarding pass. The front desk staff was extremely nice. We asked if we could have a late check out since our plane wasn’t leaving until the afternoon, and they gave it to us without a problem. There was a deli that sold sandwiches and snacks, along with various sundry items. Self parking was free in a garage across the street, but there was a charge for valet parking.
reviews.title: Quiet and Calm Yet Close to the Action

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a 5-night stay here and would certainly return there the next time we go to Las Vegas.
reviews.title: Highly Recommend

reviews.text: We arrived at midday and despite check-in being 4pm we were given our room straight away. Check-in was very quick and efficient. We were in the North Tower which was smaller and were told also quieter than the main building - it was ideal for us. We were on the 8th floor so had great view from our window, over the pool area.
reviews.title: Great location with large rooms for families.

reviews.text: When we arrived there was coffee etc in our room. Bathroom amenities were shampoo, conditioner, body lotion and soap, all replaced daily.
reviews.title: Outstanding Vacation

reviews.text: We booked a King bed studio room and this was very spacious and ideal for us. As there is so much to do in LV you don't spend much time in your room. The room had a large jacuzzi bath and wash hand basin open onto main area with a separate shower and WC.
reviews.title: Spacious elegant accomodations in a great location

aka: Hilton Grand Vacations At The Flamingo Hotel
description: Hilton Grand Vacations at the Flamingo is perfect for the traveler who enjoys being on the Strip and appreciates being able to retreat to the quiet comfort of luxury living. Studios, one and two-bedroom suites allow business and leisure travelers an opportunity to relax while also enjoying the swimming complex, free Internet, fitness center, deli and more.
